title: Banned for nothing ('intentional feeding')

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
Today I played a game as Teemo jungle.
Yeah, I know that it's a weird pick, but i play in Bronze ELO and i had success with Teemo in general before.

I decided to go a tanky build and take a support function in the game.
Problem was, that I got a pretty toxic team. And that's not everything: 
after 10 minutes i disconnected.
After I reconnected, everything was still fine: I went into my jungle and farmed to close the gap in levels.

But I realized, that my ping went crazy, when there were more than one enemy champ in my screen + I had FPS-drops.
I decided to do my best for my team, even in that situation.

For the rest of the game i depushed every pushing lane and planted my shrooms around important objectives (baron + drake for example)
I could even stop solo splitpushes of the enemy team.

Because I coudn't join teamfight because of the lags and fps-drops, my team started to flame me and called me a troll.
(even though the enemy team had a Bard, who fought several times alone against baron)
I can understand their frustration but the reason for the frustration was the throw of our team.
(one reason was me, another reason was the yasuo, who got cocky and soraka got lags)

After the game I got disconnected from chat and I got the message 'you have been banned for intentional feeding (14-days)'
And here is the problem: The reason for the ban was the Teemo game. (i died twice and not intentional)

So I contacted the riot support but the only answer was exactly the same. 
> 'you got banned for 14-days due to intentional feeding', 'it's against the summoners code', 'ruins the fun for others'



I ask everyone, who got banned without a reason:
1. Have they unbanned your account?
2. Do you think the ban is justified?

Here is the Link to the game, that was the reason for the 'intentional feeding'-ban
_http://matchhistory.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/EUW1/2842981553/224154786_
And here is my player profile that shows, that i don't feed intentional:
_http://www.lolskill.net/summoner/EUW/cSenira/summary
_
Greetings
**cSenira**

replies.body: This appears to be a false positive. I've unbanned the account for you because I didn't want you to have to wait for your ticket, and will follow up with my team to see what exactly caused the penalty.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=l9fpef28,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2016-09-16T18:41:21.809+0000)
>
> This appears to be a false positive. I've unbanned the account for you because I didn't want you to have to wait for your ticket, and will follow up with my team to see what exactly caused the penalty.

When riot screws up and fixes the problem! good job riot! just do it more often if you can :)
more often? false positives aren't common

> [{quoted}](name=dapositiveviking,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=l9fpef28,comment-id=000900010000,timestamp=2016-09-16T19:52:16.757+0000)
>
> more often? false positives aren't common

I was banned for "intentional feeding" (I wasn't) but I had other toxic behavior on my account so I couldn't contest the behavior that triggered it (because even if they unfairly banned me for feeding, they would have banned me for the rest of it)

Only thing that sucks is that it went straight from zero to perma. I would have stopped lmao.
beg to differ

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/cETPvHAE-black-alistar-king-rammus

This dude has 171 comments/5.7k views/200+ upvotes and you rioters have yet to leave a comment to him about his 'ban'
And which would that be?

Which **specific** bans are you referring to?
It's easy to just state that they exist and perpetuate the paranoia some people have when it comes to the system.
It's slightly more difficult to link threads or copy reform cards of these "real false bans".

Doesn't sound like it, honestly, given that he himself states he was permabanned for one game after coming out of his 14 day ban.
Either way, you know the thing where I mentioned **links**? Making me search for the evidence, rather than presenting it, really makes you even less credible a source.

Edit: Searching through his discussion history, it really doesn't sound credible.
He's used a large variety of excuses for his ban... including one where he was really hacked by another person, who then got the account permabanned and then started using unbelievable excuses to get their account back.
Why would you believe this person? I mean, that's an honest question. What makes you believe him?

Edit2: Hell, he even "aplogized" (possibly sarcastic) for his logs **AFTER** he claimed that he wasn't the one responsible for them.

Because it most likely simply didn't happen.

Have you seen how he jumps between his excuses? He's just been fooling around with friends, no wait, it happened before his 14-day ban, no wait he's actually been hacked.

I mean, even if you believe him, his last story is actually that he doesn't know who claimed that he was banned for a game before his 2-week ban, and that it was in fact somebody who hacked him that commited the offenses. So yeah, even if you believe him, that story about it being a bug isn't true.

Edit: Which actually means there are only two possibilities for your source regarding that story:
Either your source is a liar, or your source is a hacker.

Assuming that it's the truth, no, obviously it wouldn't be.
But you were talking about "real false bans", not "hypothetical false bans".

**IF** he is telling the truth.
The **IF** portion makes this a hypothetical false ban.
You are basically saying "Hypothetically it could be not hypothetically", which while technically accurate is an inherently vacuous statement.

There's another pretty popular thread that could use your attention when you're free. 
Front page, can't miss it.
well i guess it isn't true what people say about riot games....

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=l9fpef28,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2016-09-16T18:41:21.809+0000)
>
> This appears to be a false positive. I've unbanned the account for you because I didn't want you to have to wait for your ticket, and will follow up with my team to see what exactly caused the penalty.

I am very jealous of the OP.

wait you went 7 and 2 and got banned for inting??????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????? WTF I HAVE PEOPLE LEGIT RUN INTO THE ENEMY TEAM ON PURPOSE AND FLAME EVERYONE THAT DONT GET BANNED WTF

To be fair, the 7/2/6 makes it unlikely, but not impossible that he was griefing. This game lasted over an hour. Intentionally throwing a single teamfight can end the game, leaving your stats still virtually untouched, but still ruining the game.
If we ignore the precise words "intentional feeding" and take a general look at ways to grief, afk-farming the jungle also comes to mind (experienced it in the past), which doesn't even directly affect your stats at all.

All that said, I do believe such a special case deserves the attention of a red, to either overturn or explain the punishment.
Not only because his stats were this good, but also because I can see some things that realistically might have triggered a false positive (e.g. selling all items and going for a different build)
If you want someone banned for afk farming the jungle, then people who say "it's normals" or "it's just a game" need to be permabanned.
I'm not talking about tunnel-visioned junglers. I'm talking about people **intentionally** making the team lose by refusing to participate in anything outside of jungle.

The only one who fed intentional was the enemy wukong who jumped several times alone in my whole team.
I have the feeling that there is sth wrong with the report system for some time now.

Heard several cases of bans for weird reasons.

Well. All i can do is hoping for a response of the Riot support. 
Otherwise i have to wait 2 weeks to play again...

You should get an email detailing the ban. If it doesn't say right in there intentional feeding I'm not sure I can believe this.

I have played with PLENTY of feeders and only the ones that type into chat "LOLOLOL I'M JUST GONNA FEED THEN FUCKERS!!!!!111" ever catch a ban.

I didn't even receive a mail.
Only the short ban-notification. 
That's another reason, why I am confused.

I was banned for being afk before (bad internet connection and playing is a bad idea)
and got a mail for this. But I received no e-mail for that ban.
where does it say which games got you banned?

When you log-in you get the ban massage.
It says for what reason you are banned and then the games in which this case occurs.
And the link was that Teemo game.

That's why i am confused that I got a ban for intentional feeding. (I died 2 times and that not intentional. what a feed)
oh i didn't realize that

No problem.
Thanks that you took your time and red my post.

But i am very confused about the report system right now.

> [{quoted}](name=cSenira,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=l9fpef28,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-09-15T20:59:54.609+0000)
>
> When you log-in you get the ban massage.
> It says for what reason you are banned and then the games in which this case occurs.
> And the link was that Teemo game.
> 
> That's why i am confused that I got a ban for intentional feeding. (I died 2 times and that not intentional. what a feed)

To be fair 2 deaths i would say is the minimal someone can "Intentionally Feed". I mean most people think intentionally feeding is just going into lane, dying, going back into lane, and dying again. that right there is two deaths. With that said seeing how Riot doesnt flat out state you were ban from that Teemo game, it could just be a delayed punishment and you could have fed/trolled in a different game and it only actually registered till now!

Yeah but not even one of the deaths was intentional.
When you look at the map, you can see that I died top (against a splitpushing ashe)
and right in front of my own base (while defending).

And i can say, that i haven't fed intentional before.
YOu can look at my match history and you will see that there is not one game, where i fed on purpose.

That's why i made this post: i am very confused about this ban.
No notifications or anything. Just banned for 14 days for a strange reason.

> [{quoted}](name=cSenira,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=l9fpef28,comment-id=0000000000010000,timestamp=2016-09-15T21:15:09.884+0000)
>
> Yeah but not even one of the deaths was intentional.
> When you look at the map, you can see that I died top (against a splitpushing ashe)
> and right in front of my own base (while defending).
> 
> And i can say, that i haven't fed intentional before.
> YOu can look at my match history and you will see that there is not one game, where i fed on purpose.
> 
> That's why i made this post: i am very confused about this ban.
> No notifications or anything. Just banned for 14 days for a strange reason.

seeing how trolling/feeding is an automatic 14 day ban they do take this type of stuff seriously especially if its in rank. which again could mean that it was probably from the past as they need to confirm you were intentionally feeding!

That's the point: I have never fed intentional. (i wrote this post because of that and because i am confused)
If I wrote sth like that, I bet they would have put that under the reasons why i got banned.
But there was nothing except the teemo game. I got 0 information. And the reason surprised me the most.

And to be honest: I had a long winning streak but lost alot lately and dropped.
But there was not even a single game, where i fed on purpose.

> [{quoted}](name=cSenira,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=l9fpef28,comment-id=000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-15T21:28:03.698+0000)
>
> That's the point: I have never fed intentional. (i wrote this post because of that and because i am confused)
> If I wrote sth like that, I bet they would have put that under the reasons why i got banned.
> But there was nothing except the teemo game. I got 0 information. And the reason surprised me the most.
> 
> And to be honest: I had a long winning streak but lost alot lately and dropped.
> But there was not even a single game, where i fed on purpose.

But how can you prove that? we only know from the final score. As i said before the minimal someone could intentionally feed is two deaths. With that i see some games already from your match history that could be considered feeding. The Annie game where you went 12/8/7, Gragas 7/10/5, Shen 6/11/6, Singed 11/11/11. if we only go by the stats these could all be considered feeding since we dont know how often these death happen. like if they happen one after another!

Yeah you have a point.
I can only say that i never fed intentional but these games could be the case scorewise.

But i can say for sure that I haven't fed once intentional.
(when you look at the gragas and singed game you can see that my whole team was way behind)

And the shen game was just very bad played.

I sended another support ticket for more information.
I think it's important to have sceptical people like you around.

> [{quoted}](name=Sarutobi,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=l9fpef28,comment-id=0000000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-15T21:48:45.746+0000)
>
> But how can you prove that? we only know from the final score. As i said before the minimal someone could intentionally feed is two deaths. With that i see some games already from your match history that could be considered feeding. The Annie game where you went 12/8/7, Gragas 7/10/5, Shen 6/11/6, Singed 11/11/11. if we only go by the stats these could all be considered feeding since we dont know how often these death happen. like if they happen one after another!

Even if he intentionally fed those two deaths by being stupid or running it down mid 1v5 there's no reason for him to be banned when people die 10 times as much doing stupid crap in game all the time. You trying to propose a world that likely didn't happen which justifies a ban for dying twice is completely silly and unnecessary.

"After the game I got disconnected from chat and I got the message 'you have been banned for intentional feeding (14-days)'"

Then obviously it wasn't because of that game. These things take awhile to add up. You can't just feed once and be banned for feeding, they wait to make sure you're deserving of the ban. I'd honestly report you for AFK too, due to how your bad internet connection contributed to the loss of the game. I wouldn't want you to be banned for it, but it would only ban you if a lot of people also reported you for AFK in your other games, in which case you'd deserve the ban. 

It's completely possibly you were banned for doing this in a normals game, something we wouldn't be able to see. Or maybe on another account, or maybe it really is an error in which case I wish you the best of luck, or maybe you're lying. Honestly 99% of people that come here are lying so don't take it personal when I say that.
he said he got the link to that game from the ban message. do you read

That's not how reports work. If I go into a game, do fine but my team reports me for intentional feeding, after the game I'm simply not going to be banned. Now if I intentionally feed a few times, go into a game and do fine, after the game I might be banned. Even if that isn't the game that I intentionally feed in, it takes more than one game and more than one day for these things to happen. 

What could have happened was maybe he was incredibly toxic in that game, and someone reported him for intentional feeding because they thought it would get him in more trouble. The system picks up that he was extremely toxic and deserves a ban because of this game and his past games, but its labeled under Intentional Feeding by error because someone reported him that way. 

I actually explained this in my post, so the not reading comment seems a bit ironic.

Wow even in the past week there's practically no games you've played that look like you're ever feeding, let alone intentionally. That's fucked up man I hope you get it figured out :/

That being said, I know nothing other than your final scores and maybe you did feed int. No one can just take your word for it ... idk man. Good luck.

Riot gets "Intentional Feeding Bans" wrong in a lot of cases and its hard to get them to over-turn a ban takes a lot of arguing with Riot so to speak, Last time I got intentional feeder ban was having my own team member troll me screwing over the entire game without in ability to /remake or change champion the entire game got tilted and like 0-20 for that matter, which was like a single game that could even remotely look like hard intentional feeding.

Last season or two ago  I had the problem being matched with (IMO) idiot players every time and I do feed when matched with such players like hard its easy to tilt me hard, now Riot has put on Auto Fill, and started matching me with dummies again, afraid of getting banned for intentional Feeding like last season with forced roles and idiots, to the point where the only option is to like sit back all game and not play because like that is the only way not to feed so much with a troll player, or someone who knows nothing its the reason I prefer all burst / mage champions in solo / farm only. (Was hard to get them to at least lower this ban from a perm ban.) But the stats do show that when matched with scrubs in a forced position it creates a more negative experience, and players argue.

Riot should keep the role selection like it was where players have the option to wait the additional time, and they need to look at more about Intentional Feeding rather than feeding because of a role or position, and even the chat toxicity others love to start when someone is forced into a role looks at the team comp and is like What the F*** is this and does something off the meta only to hear verbal abuse and have to type /Mute All...

Perhaps players should always wait in the summoners base instead of going into fights when you "Know you are gonig to die" because no one on your team took any (Crowd Control) as this is "Intentional Feeding"?

Like please Riot?
Why did you sell all your items at one point?
TFW its been 3 hours since you posted and riot hasnt commented

Doesn't make any sense. I would send in another support ticket. I can't see any reason for you to banned unless it was a Leaverbuster thing where you've repeatedly AFKed on a 20 minute queue timer.

I've had much worse games as Teemo Jg.

I did.
I wait for their answer.
Hope it's not again the automatic massage.

My worst game in the last month was a 6/11/6 shen game.
Where i got stomped from a smurfing jax+lee sin.

I am just very confused about that.
Everyone was very rude in that Teemo game,
so i used the /mute all command.
And i am surprised that the 'intentional feeding'-ban was used by riot.

You should have seen my face when i got disconnected from chat and tried to reconnect xD
I got the notification after i logged in again.
